title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: 1 screener call with a recruiter, then an interview with the hiring manager, and then three interviews with people I would be working closely with. Ochsner moved quickly, so I didn't mind so many rounds. They were also very transparent about the process and pay/hybrid model. Their handling of the rejection was off-putting, and ruined the whole experience. I found out I was out of consideration, when I couldn't find the calendar invite for the final round of interviews. I reached out to the recruiter first, and then the hiring manager. I didn't get a response from either. A week later, I got the official automated rejection email.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple projects with competing deadlines?

title: Pre Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was nice and simple, they really made me feel comfortable. I was nervous in the beginning but after a while I was able to warm up. They basically wanted to know about me and my background and they gave me an idea of the role I was applying for
Interview Questions: Think of a time you felt defeated

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great, she made me feel comfortable and she was patient At first I was really nervous before the call but then when she started talking it went by fast
Interview Questions: What was the salary pay I was expected

title: Financial Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: - Multiple Zoom interviews and emails over about 3 months - Spoke to the Director as well as the team of analysts I would be working with - Described the position well and what the responsibilities of the role included

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ochsner Health

Interview Questions: How many years have I done this kind of work.

title: System Adminstrator Interview

title: RN New Grad Interview

Interview Questions: What would you do if you inserted a FC and did not get a urine return? What are some common ICU drugs you have administered, and what did they do?

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: Straight a forward, normal interview. Easy-going interview. Be prepared for at least a 45 minute interview. Normal interview questions. I enjoyed speaking with the hiring manager, hoping to continue the conversation soon.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current role?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: If they like your application, you will receive a phone call from a recruiter. They will so a quick interview and then decided to go forward with the interview with the department lead.
Interview Questions: How many year of experience do you have?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions:
A couple weeks after applying, an HR person for Ochsner Baptist contacted me, and we completed a phone interview later that week. HR asked about pay expectations, I said a figure, and "this is the minimum I would accept".

Another week passes and an in-person interview is scheduled. I asked the HR person, "did you tell them what pay rate I need?", and I received an enthusiastic yes.

In-person interviewers "forgot" I was coming in to interview and were clearly overwhelmed by the workload, which is not their fault, but didn't bode well. Interview was basic, albeit a little forced. I think they asked questions not really caring much about the answers... felt as if they were just going through the motions. I did notice a huge list of at least 20 "new hires" on the wall, which is pretty telling, considering the small size of the ED there.

Yet another week later, HR calls with a job offer, for less than the minimum rate I stated in the initial phone screening nearly a month earlier. I declined the job immediately.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself.

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, easy going interviewer, answered all my questions with no problem, left with a good feeling I would get a call back with an offer. Got an offer for more than I thought I would be offered
Interview Questions: How did I deal with a problem co worker?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: I was asked 5 questions and the meeting lasted 15 minutes this was my second interview. My first interview was a phone call & my second interview was a zoom meeting.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a great fit for Ochsner ?

title: Digital Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds- first with recruiter then with hiring manager.  Easy interview; however never hear back from recruiter or hiring manager . When emailed hiring manager, they said they are still reviewing even after 2 months. Then got a rejection email for a job that I didn't even applied. Quite unprofessional for such a large organization.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Ochsner?

title: Clinician Interview

title: RN Interview

Interview Descriptions: There were many steps involved. Tried to return the call for 3 weeks. Tried contacting the unit manager as well. Finally got ahold of the manager only to be told that I was still in the running, but they were continuing to interview. The recruiter called me the Monday after, which by then had been 3 weeks since her initial call, and said the job was filled.

I went to my shadow shift and things seemed to go great but I never heard back from anyone. I tried contacting my recruiter for answers but I never heard back from anyone. title: Unit Secretary Interview

Interview Questions: For example how would you handle a difficult patient? How wiuld you handle having to complete myltiple task at once?

title: DOSC Interview

title: Staff RN Interview

title: Scheduler Interview

I was escorted to 2 different floors to observe the employees on phone calls scheduling and assisting patients and family members. Lastly, I was introduced to some of the staffing and management teams.

title: Senior Neurodiagnostic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick response, phone interview with HR, phone interview with supervisor, then a 3 hour in person interview with the team and the doctors. HR then called within a few days to make an offer, this is where you must begin negotiations for your worth.
Interview Questions: Mostly just asked about experience and told me how their program was run.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Referred by another employee. Applied online then received a phone call, almost like a phone interview and to set up an in person interview on the unit. Interview consisted of behavioral questions and a "shadow" shift.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by TA. Phone interview with hiring mgr. in person with panel of 5-8 directors; in person with VP, in person with CNO; in person with MDs; in person with staff; in person with support service panel 3-5; offer sent after 3 days of interviews.
Interview Questions: Leadership style? How to motivate others?

title: OLI/Talent Management Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA)
Interview Descriptions:
Very lengthly process that consisted of a phone screen with the Recruiting Manager, a one-on-one interview with the Director, one interview with an AVP, two panel interviews with the team and I facilitated three presentations. All of the interviews and presentations were grouped together so I only went to the office three times. 

The best part has been that the team members are awesome and extremely knowledgable which made it a joy to see them at each round of the interview process and has continued to leave me excited about the potential to work with them. 

I can tell that they are concerned about making the right choice for the anticipated project work load, which is understandable. I haven't been extended an offer at this time, I'm still waiting to hear their final decision.
Interview Questions: How would you handle producing training on a short timeline?

title: Nursing Supervisor Surgery Clinic Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Jefferson, LA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The face to face interviews were succinct and effective on allowing me to show my strengths and how I could benefit the unit  I have been through a one on one interview with the upper management and also with the fellow RNs in the clinic.  This has been in the last 6 weeks and I have yet to hear any feedback regarding a decision.  According to the website, the process in still in progress.
Interview Questions: What could I do for the company

title: StaffRN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Jefferson, LA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed over the phone. Shadowed the unit and was offered the job a few days later. I had to get a Louisiana license prior to my start date which was not emphasized by HR. Thus, my start date was postponed after moving to Arlington.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to this unit?

title: Revenue Cycle Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: In my opinion there is too many people to interview with. You may have up to three different interviews which can be over a period of weeks before starting the job, and that is if you are hired. I went through the process three times before getting the job.
Interview Questions: How I handled tough situations.

title: Systems Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a long and slow process. There were multiple callbacks for panel type as well as one on one interview that included different representatives of mulitple departments. They felt i was z better fit for z different position so i had more interviews than average. They made me feel comfortable. Outside of the multiple visits to the facility it was an interesting experience
Interview Questions: Why do you want go work for us?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from the secretary. Interviewed with the director of Clinical Research. Asked What kind Clinical Research experience do you have. Meet with the clinical team leader and the clinical PI. The long wait is for the HR to process. You can watch the progress online. After 4 weeks got the offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose ochsner? What kind Clinical Research experience do you have?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Screened by an entry level screener, then a recruiter, then with a VP.  All by telephone.
Had the exact background they were looking for per recruiter.  VP did not call at time scheduled so had to reschedule with recruiter for 2 days later.  VP had his assistant call me 10 minutes after the next scheduled time.  VP did not apologize for being late.  Did not get a great first impression.  During the call I thought it went well despite VP needing to end call early to pick up his children from day care.  I was unable to ask many questions and was given the impression there would be a next step.  This call did not leave me with a good lasting impression.  VP did not even provide contact info to write a simple thank you.  Emailed recruiter for update and was told they had moved on.  Very disappointed in this organization that is supposed to be ranked highly in the region.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your current employer.

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume for another position, but I wasn't chosen.  The recruiter did think I was qualified for another position within the company.  The recruiter did the phone interview with me (assuming to decide if I should go to the next phase of the process).  The interview was a panel including the department leader.  Good questions, especially with a qualification/personality tact twist.  Everyone was very pleasant even though I didn't understand what I my role would be in the department exactly.   Lasted about 1.5 hours.  I was amazed by how many young executives were the heart of the organization.
Interview Questions: How would I face a difficult executive member?

title: Strategic Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first interviewed with the department manager and was then asked to prepare a powerpoint on a business solutions scenario. I had 1 week to put together the presentation and it was pretty straight forward. I made that presentation to the department of my peers. Subsequently, I was invited to meet with more the 12 additional staff members including executive staff for 1-on-1 interviews
Interview Questions: How would I manage an executive staff member that was holding up a project?

title: Analyst/Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
A week out from applying, they call you to set up a time to take Epic's assessment test. The test is basically a logic test and is meant to see how well you can solve problems and whether your a good candidate for certification. 

About 2 weeks after testing, I received a call from a PM wanting to set up a time for me to come down to interview with a group of PMs. You interview individually with the groups of PMs. I didn't really get any advanced interview questions. I was just asked to kind of go through my resume and explain what I did, why I wanted the job, and how long I was going to stay at Ochsner (apparently they lose a lot of people). The second interview was with 1 PM and the director, and was the basically the same interview all over again. 

Two weeks (exactly) after that I got a call from HR with an offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Clinical Pharmacy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, met with director of pharmacy, pharmacists in the department, nurses, and physician. Was toured around the hospital and pharmacy. Very few hard questions, mostly conversational and them asking if I had any questions. ~7 hours in length, no presentation required.
Interview Questions: What do you like about precepting students?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Application was sent to hiring manager after a couple days after I applied. Talked to the hiring manager a few weeks later about working on the floor. After speaking with the hiring manager a few hours later I got a call from human resources extending and offer.
Interview Questions: If I tested for nclex?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions:
Spoke with HR first to answer very generic questions

In person Interview was with the Clinical Coordinator who asked questions about my schooling and what i knew about the unit. We then ended the interview with a tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Not many clinical questions

title: Revenue Cycle Representative III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I received a call for the position to come in and interview. I asked a brief information about what they were looking for, and the schedule I was told that it was Monday - Friday, 3-11pm. Which I was looking for. However when I got into the interview I was told that the rotate weekends. Since they were not initially honest about the hours I waited until the job shadow and asked the worker I was shadowing then I was informed that you work two weekends out if the month which was not what the supervisor made it seem like. Then I was informed they work holidays.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my ability to handle private information. How I felt about working around very sick people. How I felt about taking payments and insurance information. I was also explained job shadowing that was not paid time and the training. The employees in the department had nothing but complaints about the supervisor

title: RN Operations Coordinator Interview

title: Project Manager Interview

title: Patient Access Representative Interview

title: Revenue Cycle Representative III Interview

what inspires me?

Interview Descriptions: Depends On If The Department Is In Great Need At The Moment

Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Jan 2014

title: Dietary Interview

Interview Descriptions: Typical interview. Many questions of tell me a time when this happened and how did you react.
Interview Questions: None just chose some senerios before you go. Such as a time you dealt with a difficult customer.

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: Laid back. If you bring your personality, charm, wit, mixed with some intelligence, you have nothing to worry about. You set the tone of the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, job shadowing was a plus. The job description was given and the amount of time it took for the interview could have been shorter.  The interview was pleasant and also met with the chairman of the department.
Interview Questions: Why would you be an asset to the team?

title: Appointment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: About two weeks after I submitted my resume I was contacted for an interview.  My interview was the next day.  I was unofficially offered the position then, but I was told I had to wait for HR to contact me.  HR contaced me about 3 weeks later and offered me the position.  My first day was scheduled for two weeks away.  The hiring process has been very interesting.  I have been employed for several weeks, but my manager has yet to get me trained with the computer system so I can do my new job.  I have been watching my co-workers and training with them as best I can.  I have not really been given much guidance on my work schedule (as the different departments I am moved to work on different schedules), my uniform (another thing I am waiting to be decided on), where I will work, and several other things.  It seems this is a very disorganized company.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to work for Ochsner?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Elmwood, LA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Take a test - similar to LSAT logic test.  Timed. Come in for interview - talk to several project managers. Come back in for a second interview. Get drug tested. Everyone was very nice.
Interview Questions: Name an example of when you had to work with a difficult person. Other situational questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: the interview went well. there were two people interviewing me. they showed me around the hospital. and i shadowed a rn to see if i wanted the job. i was told to give them a call in a few days to see if i accepted the job. i call the manager back in 3 days and i accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be apart of ochsner

title: Revenue Cycle Representative III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview with 2 different hiring managers
Interview Questions: very easy interview

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Kenner, LA) in Apr 2013

title: Registration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Interviewed a week later. Job offer the week after.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions; greatest strengths & weaknesses. Customer Service.

title: Human Resources Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was long, but this is not a bad thing. They were looking for the right fit employee.  Application online first, then a very long 100+ question survey was completed for mostly clinical preferences.  I had no clinical work experience prior to this.  Interview with Dept Director, then interviewed with hospital leadership.  I also interviewed with the HR dept staff in a panel style interview. Finally interviewed with AVP of HR.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Network Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA)
Interview Descriptions: Their HR department is the worst on the planet. The person I was working with was great but she was at the mercy of slow co-workers and the hiring manager was dragging his feet as well. I called every other day to keep it fresh in their mind that I was interested.
Interview Questions: What are your goals for your career.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple, I met with the director of the unit I would be working on and interviewed face to face. She asked real simple questions regarding the posting I applied for and I was called back the exact same day with a job offer.
Interview Questions: How long was I a nurse

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Once references were entered and checked, telephone interview scheduled. They were 1.5 hrs late calling. (I did not care, I know they are busy, but it was nerve wracking and caused me to miss later appt by waiting by phone. I'd begun to give up when they called). Phone interview went well. Was called for three other interviews. The interviewers were kind, professional, and helpful, and gave advice when asked.
So I would advise anyone to be very patient and polite. The wheels can turn slowly. I shadowed twice. It was an opportunity for the staff and you to see dynamic of the unit and assess fit.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 yrs?

title: Network Administrator III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Metairie, LA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the director of IT.  He was short but to the point on his expectations of the candidate for the position.  He was very specific in their needs to have a full turnaround in how employees viewed the performance of the IT department.  Making the employees feel that their needs were not going to get ignored.  At the time employees were opening a ticket for the problems and then emailing anyone they know in IT to see if it can be pushed along and then notifying their supervisor who would send emails to check on the issue all in the same day.  They were use to having a 7 to 14 day wait for an answer to simple non-emergency issues and were not surprised when the question would go unanswered and the case closed without resolution.  These types of issues were first on his agenda to rectify.
Interview Questions: What was my most memorable accomplishment?

title: Revenue Cycle Representative III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Originally, put in application online website--no response. Ochsners HR is deplorable and no follow up.
When mass hire began for new EMR, I was able to be interviewed and was hired through third party HR firm.
Interview Questions:
N/A
Very generic questions

title: Revenue Cycle Representative/Patient Registration Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a mass interview but pleasant. Nice environment and relaxed setting. My interviewer was the Director of department and she was very forthcoming with job duties and that they were launching a new program for patient registration and it would be a two week class training.

Interview Questions: Why ochsner

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Leadership test, HR phone interview, leadership test, on site panel interviews with 10 people over the course of one day, follow-up phone interview with VP.  Top 3 candidates will be interviewed again.
Rigorous selection process. I learned a lot about myself thoughout this interview process. They seemed like a great team to join.
Interview Questions: Do you consider yourself a leader?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse 24/7 Medsurg Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Engaging. Challenging but doable. Four people sitting stacked in a very small room with tablets making notes. One asking questions.  Not sure who was who at first. Was introduced by names but not job titles. I looked it up later, but proceeded as if every face in the room could very well have been the CEO. The facility was under construction at the time space was limited.  Construction has since been completed.
Interview Questions: As a nurse what do you do with your free time?

title: Community Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: They made me fill out a ridiculous number of forms and questionaires. Then, I was interviewed over the phone by someone in HR, who told me I would be interviewed by a VP, also a phone interview. The VP interview was downright silly. The woman asked pre-canned questions and then wondered aloud if I had "the energy" to do the job. I'm honestly glad it didn't go any further. By the way, the VP had nothing good to say about the doctors at the hospital. She kept complaining that the doctors "think they know everything about everyone's job." Well, her comments told me more about her than the doctors.
Interview Questions: "How would you handle a doctor who started yelling at you in the hall?"

title: Registration Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Raceland, LA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview for me was unique because I had previously worked for the organization. I received a phone call which setup an interview with the individuals that I would be working for, received a call a few days later and waited on my background check to become complete before I could begin working.
Interview Questions: What are your strongest strengths?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (Baton Rouge, LA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: My interview went very well and they were interested in me also.  They asked that I do a "shadow shift" to be sure I liked the unit, work pace, employees, etc.  I did the shadow shift, which was a night shift. I slept until late afternoon to prepare, drove an hour there and worked 4 hours.  They said everything went great and they would be in contact to start hospital orientation.  After two weeks and no contact, I called human resources.  After they went through my file, the lady said they hired someone else for the position!  And they did not even compensate me for the "shadow shift"!  I have never heard of a hospital doing this and I certainly would not have wasted my time for free!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I only had one interview for my job, and it was a very relaxed atmosphere. I had already worked in a different department, so I was known by the organization, but not by the people in this department. It was mostly about them getting to know me and ensuring that I was a good fit.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time things didn't go according to plan and how you resolved the resulting issues

title: MANAGER, CLINICAL SERVICES Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ochsner Health (New Orleans, LA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview
Interview Questions: Scenarios - difficult situation, conflict resolution.

title: Financial Service Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: applied for the position in june 09, called in july 09 for an interview, first interview went great was not to satisify with the salary...was called in for a second interview, intwerview with 5 people. was called the next day with a job offer. declined the job because did not like the salary
